Package game

Class ProxyPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.ProxyObject
      • game.ProxyPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GamePlayer, java.lang.Runnable
    public abstract class ProxyPlayer
extends ProxyObject
implements GamePlayer, java.lang.Runnable
    A Player object that is a proxy for the real player, which is somewhere else on the network. Each ProxyPlayer

    • Method Detail

      • encodeState

        protected abstract java.lang.String encodeState​(GameState gs)
        Transforms a GameState object into a string so that it may be sent across the network. The decodeState method (of the ProxyGame subclass that is associated with this game) should be written so that it can reconstruct the object from the string.
        Parameters:
        gs - the GameState object
        Returns:
        the encoded string

      • decodeAction

        protected abstract GameAction decodeAction​(java.lang.String s)
        Transforms a string into a GameAction object. This method should be written to reconstruct any object that had been transformed to a string by the ProxyGame subclass for this game.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to transform
        Returns:
        the GameAction object that corresponds to the string

      • run

        public void run()
        The code that runs during the object's lifetime.
        Specified by:

                    int playerId)

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        game - the game object
        playerId - the unique numeric player-id assigned to this player by the game

      • notYourMove

        public void notYourMove()
        Notifies the player know that it's not his move. Typically called by the game object when the player has made a move out-of-turn.
        Specified by:
        notYourMove in interface GamePlayer

      • timeToQuit

        public void timeToQuit()
        Notifies a player that it is time to quit. Typically called by the game object when a player has indicated a desire to quit.
        Specified by:
        timeToQuit in interface GamePlayer

      • invalidRequest

        public void invalidRequest()
        Notifies a player that a request he had made is invalid. (For example, if the player request a "quit", but he is not allowed to.) Typically called by the game object.
        Specified by:
        invalidRequest in interface GamePlayer

      • illegalMove

        public void illegalMove()
        Notifies a player that the move he made is illegal. (For example, moving a non-king checkers-piece backwards.) Typically called by the game object when an illegal move has been detected.
        Specified by:
        illegalMove in interface GamePlayer

      • gameIsOver

        public void gameIsOver()
        Notifies a player that the game is over. Typically called by the game object when the game has been terminated.
        Specified by:
        gameIsOver in interface GamePlayer

      • stateChanged

        public void stateChanged()
        Notifies a player that the state of the game has changed. Typically called by the game object when an opponent has made a move, and the player may want to take the move into account (e.g., to display it on the screen.
        Specified by:
        stateChanged in interface GamePlayer

      • finishUp

        public void finishUp()
        Notifies the player that all players have acknowledged that the game will be "quit". Gives the player last chance to "clean up". (E.g., closing windows, terminating network connections, closing files.) Typically called by the Game object just before the entire program terminates.
        Specified by:
        finishUp in interface GamePlayer

      • sendMessage

        protected final void sendMessage​(java.lang.String msg)
        Sends a game-specific specific message across the network.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to send

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Gets the player's numeric id from the prospective of the game it's playing in. (E.g., 0 if player 0, 1 if player 1.)
        Specified by:
        getId in interface GamePlayer
        Returns:
        the player's numeric id, from the game's viewpoint.

      • getGame

        public Game getGame()
        Gets the game
        Returns:
        the game object we're playing in.

      • finishInit

        protected void finishInit()
        Description copied from class: ProxyObject
        Finish initialization. Subclasses may put behavior here that they want to execute after the socket-connection has been established.
        Overrides:
        finishInit in class ProxyObject

        Tells whether the player is ready to play the game.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
